items.title: BharatPe chief marketing officer resigns to start venture
items.summary:
- The Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) of BharatPe has resigned to pursue a new venture.
- This change marks a significant shift within the company as it continues to evolve.
- Further details about the new venture were not disclosed in the announcement.

items.title: XPeng tops January EV sales with 268% growth
items.summary:
- XPeng Motors led January 2025 EV sales with 30,350 deliveries, a 268% year-on-year increase.
- Strong demand for the Mona (over 15,000 deliveries) and P7+ (surpassing 20,000 deliveries) models drove growth.
- Li Auto followed with 29,927 deliveries, while Leapmotor achieved 25,170 and reported profitability in Q4 2024.
- Xiaomi’s SU7 also performed well with over 20,000 units delivered, totaling over 150,000.
- Nio recorded 13,863 deliveries, split between Nio and Onvo brands.
- Overall EV sales declined from December due to the Spring Festival holiday and fewer working days, as per the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers.

items.title: More than half of Taiwanese use AI in 2024: report
items.summary:
- A report from Taiwan’s NCC shows that over 52.5% of the population used AI services in 2024.
- Common uses included smart navigation (84.3%), voice input technology (63.1%), and biometric authentication (57.4%).
- The report also noted that 82% of respondents aged 16 and older watched videos on video-sharing platforms, up from 75.2% in 2023. 
- YouTube remained the leading platform at 98.8%, though usage slightly declined, while TikTok's usage rose to 45.1%.

items.title: BYD, Changan expand operations in Thailand
items.summary:
- Chinese automotive companies BYD and Changan are expanding operations in Thailand.
- China accounted for 174.6 billion baht (US$5.13 billion) in foreign direct investment applications to Thailand in 2024, a 10% increase from the previous year.
- Expansions are focused in eastern Thailand, particularly Rayong Province and Chon Buri, which are part of the Eastern Economic Corridor (EEC).
- BYD launched its first EV factory in Southeast Asia in Thailand in July 2024, achieving a 41% market share in Thailand’s new energy vehicle sector.
- At the 2024 Thailand International Auto Show, BYD recorded 7,042 vehicle bookings, second only to Toyota.
- 40,000 work permits were issued to Chinese nationals in Thailand in 2024, indicating a growth in Chinese investment and trade activity.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Indonesia
items.summary:
- The article lists the top 50 funded startups and tech companies in Indonesia based on funding amounts raised from investors.
- It emphasizes the importance of funding as an indicator of a company’s potential global impact.
- The funding data included is from the past two years, ensuring the list remains current.
- Readers are encouraged to explore a more comprehensive database of tech companies in Asia and the methodology of the research.

items.title: Trump to end $800 tariff exemption, set to affect CN ecommerce
items.summary:
- The Trump administration will remove the "de minimis" tariff exemption for packages valued under $800.
- This change will impact Chinese e-commerce companies including Alibaba, JD.com, Temu, and Shein.
- The new tariffs take effect on February 4 at 12:01 am New York time, part of broader trade measures focusing on imports from China, Canada, and Mexico.
- Existing tariffs include 25% on goods from Canada and Mexico and 10% on Chinese goods.

items.title: Indonesia to impose age limits for children on social media
items.author: Meutya Hafid
items.summary:
- Indonesia's Ministry of Communication and Digital is implementing measures to protect children online.
- Key threats addressed include online gambling, pornography, cyberbullying, and sexual violence.
- A new team is to develop regulations within one to two months as per President Prabowo Subianto's directive.
- Initiatives will establish age restrictions on social media, enhance digital literacy, and improve monitoring of harmful content.
- Collaboration involves child protection, education, religious, health sectors, and NGOs.

items.title: Paytm subsidiary acquires 25% stake in US fintech for $1m
items.summary:
- Paytm Cloud Technologies Limited (PCTL) to acquire 25% stake in US fintech Seven Technology LLC for $1 million.
- This investment supports Paytm's plans to create new subsidiaries in UAE, Saudi Arabia, and Singapore.
- Seven Technology LLC operates Dinie, a fintech platform for MSMEs in Brazil.
- One97 Communications' stock rose about 1% following the announcement, reaching 750.75 rupee per share on BSE.

items.title: TSMC shares under scrutiny after DeepSeek jolt
items.summary:
- TSMC shares are being scrutinized due to recent developments related to DeepSeek.
- The stock performance has raised concerns among investors and analysts.
- Further implications of the scrutiny could affect TSMC's market position and investor confidence.

items.title: Samsung chief acquitted in 2015 merger case
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics chairman Lee Jae-yong acquitted of charges related to the 2015 Samsung affiliates merger.
- Ruling delivered by an appellate court in Seoul on Feb. 3.
- The court upheld a previous ruling from the Seoul Central District Court clearing Lee of 19 charges including stock manipulation and accounting fraud.
- Prosecutors were unable to prove the charges beyond a reasonable doubt.
- The case involved exchanges of shares between Samsung C&T and Cheil Industries.
- Lee was accused of manipulating stock prices and fraudulent accounting practices at Samsung Biologics involving over 4 trillion won (US$2.72 billion).

items.title: Taiwan to assist tech firms in Mexico amid US tariff changes
items.summary:
- Taiwan is offering assistance to technology companies in Mexico due to changes in US tariffs.
- This strategy aims to boost the competitiveness of Taiwanese firms and address challenges posed by US trade policies.
- The initiative reflects Taiwan's ongoing efforts to strengthen its economic ties in Latin America.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Indonesia
items.summary:
- The article lists Indonesian startups that are becoming notable by recently raising funding.
- The list includes companies up to the series E funding stage.
- Key details about each funding round are provided for the startups listed.

items.title: AI shake-up, courtesy of DeepSeek
items.summary:
- DeepSeek is revolutionizing AI technologies across various sectors.
- The platform enhances productivity and innovation by leveraging advanced algorithms.
- It aims to create significant competitive advantages for businesses utilizing its services.

items.title: Hong Kong proptech startup Butler profits with AI growth
items.author: Angues Chan
items.summary:
- Butler, a Hong Kong proptech startup, reported profitability in Q4 2024.
- The company’s AI-driven platform focuses on property management tasks.
- Revenue tripled in 2024 as AI solutions gained traction among real estate businesses.
- AI technologies helped reduce costs amidst a downturn in the Hong Kong property market.

items.title: OpenAI, SoftBank partner to develop $3b enterprise AI platform
items.summary:
- OpenAI and SoftBank Group are partnering to launch "Cristal Intelligence", an AI platform for enterprises.
- SoftBank plans to invest $3 billion annually to integrate OpenAI's technologies in its subsidiaries.
- A joint venture named SB OpenAI Japan will be established to customize the platform for local businesses in Japan.

items.title: Samsung Chief Awaits Ruling on Merger Fraud Allegations
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics Chair Lee Jae-yong is awaiting a ruling from the Seoul High Court on Feb. 3 regarding a 2015 merger between Samsung C&T and Cheil Industries.
- Prosecutors allege the US$8 billion merger aimed to strengthen Lee's control over Samsung and are seeking a five-year prison sentence due to alleged accounting manipulation by Samsung BioLogics.
- Lee Jae-yong denies wrongdoing; a lower court previously acquitted him, stating the merger had a 'rational business purpose'.
- The case may escalate to the Supreme Court after prosecutors' appeal.
- The merger has raised governance issues, resulting in a US$108.5 million payout to Elliott and a lawsuit from the National Pension Service.
- Concurrently, Samsung Electronics is facing market challenges, with weak AI chip sales and competition from SK hynix for Nvidia's AI product supply.

items.title: India’s EV two-wheeler sales up 24% in January, Ola leads
items.summary:
- India's electric two-wheeler market grew by 24% MoM in January 2025, with 91,264 units registered.
- Ola Electric led with 64% MoM growth, selling 22,656 units and achieving a 25% market share.
- TVS Motor and Bajaj Auto registered increases of 27% and 10%, selling 22,080 and 20,176 units respectively.
- Ather Energy's sales rose by 15% to 12,101 units but its market share decreased to 13.2%.
- Greaves Electric Mobility saw a 20% increase in registrations totaling 3,411 units.
- River, a newcomer, reported a significant 201% growth reaching 588 units.
- Overall, EV registrations across all categories in India increased by 11% to 167,000 units in January 2025.

items.title: Bitcoin drops 7% as Trump imposes new trade tariffs
items.summary:
- Cryptocurrencies, including bitcoin, declined sharply on Feb. 2 after President Trump announced new import tariffs.
- Bitcoin dropped 7% to US$93,768.66; CoinDesk 20 index fell by 19%.
- Ethereum decreased by 20%, reaching its lowest value since November.
- Tariffs include 25% on imports from Canada and Mexico, and 10% on Chinese imports, effective Feb. 4.
- These tariffs will impact nearly US$1.6 trillion in trade.

items.title: OpenAI unveils new AI agent for online research
items.summary:
- OpenAI introduced a new tool named “Deep Research” for enhancing online research efficiency.
- The tool scans text, images, PDFs, and uploaded files to generate detailed reports based on user prompts.
- OpenAI claims Deep Research can complete tasks that usually take hours in just minutes.
- It is exclusively available to ChatGPT Pro subscribers at a cost of US$200 per month.

items.title: Tether reports $13b profit in 2024
items.summary:
- Tether reported a net profit of US$13 billion for 2024, with a fourth-quarter profit of US$6 billion.
- The company's exposure to US Treasurys reached a record high of US$113 billion.
- Tether issued US$23 billion in USDT during Q4, totaling US$45 billion for the year.

items.title: These startups let you buy slices of a Bali villa for $1
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Goro offers fractional property investment in Indonesia, allowing people to invest in villas starting from 10,000 rupiah (about $0.62).
- Over 100,000 retail investors have engaged with Goro's platform for passive income from real estate.
- The Indonesian Financial Services Authority oversees a regulatory sandbox for real-world asset tokenization involving Goro, but legal ambiguities remain regarding token ownership.

items.title: India cuts import tax on smartphone parts
items.summary:
- India has removed import duties on components needed for mobile phone manufacturing as announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Feb. 1.
- The decision is intended to support domestic production and benefit companies like Apple and Xiaomi.
- Duty exemptions now apply to components like printed circuit board assemblies, camera module parts, and USB cables, which had a previous tax of 2.5%.
- The policy aims to enhance India’s global competitiveness and establish it as a major manufacturing hub, competing with China and Vietnam.

items.title: Huawei, SiliconFlow launch DeepSeek AI models on cloud
items.summary:
- Huawei partnered with AI start-up SiliconFlow to launch DeepSeek's AI models on Huawei’s Ascend cloud service.
- The collaboration introduces the large language model V3 and reasoning model R1, available for end users.
- Pricing for V3 is 1 yuan for 1M input tokens and 2 yuan for 1M output tokens; R1 is priced at 4 yuan and 16 yuan respectively for the same number of tokens.

items.title: Crypto exchange Kraken doubles revenue to $1.5b in 2024
items.summary:
- Kraken's revenue has increased to $1.5 billion in 2024.
- This marks a significant growth compared to previous years.
- Key factors contributing to this growth include increased trading volumes and expansion into new markets.

items.title: India launches $1.15b fund for startups
items.summary:
- India announced a new US$1.15 billion fund for startups as part of the federal budget for 2025-2026.
- Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman introduced the fund to enhance startup funding programs, which have previously allocated over US$1 billion.
- The specific focus areas for the fund were not detailed, despite India's startup ecosystem attracting over US$100 billion in investments in the last decade and having over 100 unicorns.

items.title: Xpeng expands to Finland, Ireland
items.summary:
- Xpeng Motors has made a strategic expansion into Finland and Ireland.
- The move is aimed at increasing its market presence in Europe.
- Xpeng plans to introduce its electric vehicles in these new markets by the end of 2023.

items.title: Trump’s chip tariffs may harm US economy: analysts
items.summary:
- Analysts warn that proposed tariffs on semiconductors could backfire and harm the US economy.
- Tariffs may lead to increased costs for US consumers, potentially contributing to inflation.
- Concerns raised that Taiwanese companies might shift production abroad, possibly leading to a global tariff war.
- The proposal aims to boost domestic chip production but faces criticism for potential negative economic effects.
- Previous tariffs from Trump included imports from Mexico, Canada, and China, affecting key semiconductor producers.

items.title: Korean automaker faces trademark battle in Turkey
items.summary:
- South Korean car manufacturer KG Mobility (formerly SsangYong Motor) is involved in a trademark dispute in Turkey.
- The Turkish Patent and Trademark Office has temporarily prohibited Cihan Turan, the trademark owner, from transferring rights since last month.
- The legal battle over trademark invalidation may last 2 to 4 years, leading to significant costs and delays.
- Turkey is a key market alongside Europe and Korea, making the dispute significant for KG Mobility.
- The company must pay royalties to use its name, complicating matters further.
- Ongoing negotiations with Turan are taking place in the EU.
- KG Mobility's alternative acronym “KGM” was rejected in Turkey due to similarities with Turkey’s General Directorate of Highways.

items.title: Optimize your operations: 3 tips for D2C growth
items.author: Jessica Belloc
items.summary:
- Shopee holds a 48% market share in Southeast Asia, making it vital for D2C brands.
- Understanding Shopee’s complexities is crucial for maximizing sales.
- Centralizing data with platforms like Odoo reduces errors and provides clear business insights.
- An omnichannel approach enhances brand visibility beyond Shopee.
- Data-driven strategies empower brands to innovate and connect with customers more effectively.

items.title: Bitcoin Mining Profit Falls Amid Harsh US Cold Snap
items.summary:
- Bitcoin's mining difficulty decreased on Jan. 27, marking the first drop since late September 2024.
- The decrease was influenced by a cold snap in the US, which raised energy prices and reduced mining profitability.
- The US holds 46% of the global Bitcoin mining hashrate, with Texas contributing 17%.
- Increased demand for natural gas and reliance on renewable energy in Texas led to higher electricity costs for mining firms.
- Miner revenue per terahash declined in January compared to December, indicating financial strain.
- Companies like Riot Platforms are seeking diversification by using mining infrastructure for AI and high-performance tasks.
- Analysts predict stability in Bitcoin's mining hashrate as US weather conditions improve.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia launched Glasswall to help founders make informed decisions about investors.
- Glasswall allows founders to share anonymous reviews about VCs to encourage open feedback.
- Contributions from founders are vital for Glasswall’s success, with opportunities for reviews of active investors in Southeast Asia.

items.title: Apple sets record revenue in India, iPhone leads sales
items.summary:
- Apple reported record revenue in India for the October-December 2024 quarter.
- The iPhone became the top-selling smartphone model in India.
- CEO Tim Cook emphasized India’s significance as the second-largest global smartphone market.
- Apple plans to open four new retail stores in Bengaluru, Pune, Delhi NCR, and Mumbai.
- The company launched the Apple Store app in India and is developing localized versions of Apple Intelligence.
- iPhone exports from India exceeded 1.08 trillion rupees (US$12.8 billion) in 2024.
- Apple is in talks with Bharat Forge as a potential vendor in India.

items.title: Coinbase buys on-chain ad platform Spindl
items.author: Antonio Garcia-Martinez
items.summary:
- Coinbase has acquired Spindl, an on-chain advertising platform.
- The acquisition details, including financial terms, were not disclosed.
- Spindl will operate under Coinbase's Layer 2 network, Base.
- Coinbase aims to integrate Spindl's technology while maintaining open standards for a fair ecosystem.

items.title: Singapore startup fileAI nets $14m series A
items.summary:
[fileAI has raised $14 million in a Series A funding round.]
[fileAI plans to use the funds to expand its product offerings and team.]
[The company focuses on AI-driven solutions for data management.]

items.title: Beyond politics: why Solo may be Indonesia’s next tech hotspot
items.summary:
- Solo, a historic city in Central Java, is positioning itself as Indonesia’s next tech hotspot with significant investments from major companies.
- Indosat Ooredoo and Nvidia are committing to build a $200 million AI center in Solo.
- The city has seen a surge in tech investments since Gibran Rakabuming Raka, son of former president Joko Widodo, became mayor in 2021.
- Major firms like Shopee, Grab, Emtek, and Bukalapak are expanding their presence in Solo, contributing to the development of Solo Smart City.
- The Solo Technopark, inaugurated in 2023, is a hub for various tech companies and offers training and co-working spaces.
- Solo's proximity to educational institutions in Yogyakarta provides a skilled talent pool for tech industries.

items.title: Shein relaunches in India after nearly 5-year ban
items.summary:
- Shein re-enters the Indian market in partnership with Reliance Retail after a nearly five-year ban due to diplomatic tensions.
- The relaunch includes the Shein India Fast Fashion app, developed by Reliance Retail.
- Reliance Retail manages the platform and customer data, with Shein acting as a technology partner, limiting their access to data stored in India.

items.title: Southeast Asia tech ecosystem report
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's startup ecosystem is evolving with ten countries contributing to a massive landscape.
- The report highlights key statistics regarding startup funding stages and distribution across various industries.
- Dominant sectors include ecommerce and fintech, with a variety of new startups emerging daily.
- The report also mentions active investors in the region, though full access requires a subscription to view detailed charts and visuals.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Singapore
50 rising startups in Singapore
items.summary:
[Highlights 50 startups making waves in Singapore's startup ecosystem]
[Spotlights diverse sectors including fintech, healthtech, and e-commerce]
[Features companies addressing regional and global challenges]

items.title: Y Combinator unveils AI opportunities for startups
items.summary:
- Y Combinator highlights new startup opportunities driven by recent AI breakthroughs.
- Emphasizes the creation of a secure AI app store focused on user privacy.
- Discusses the demand for innovative data center solutions for better power, cooling, and automation.
- Suggests startups use AI for compliance and audit automation to reduce costs.
- Identifies opportunities in developing AI personal assistants and commercialization of open-source AI technologies.

items.title: Perplexity AI sued by software firm for trademark violation
items.summary:
- Perplexity Solved Solutions (PSS) has filed a trademark infringement lawsuit against Perplexity AI in California.
- PSS claims Perplexity AI’s use of the name "Perplexity" causes consumer confusion and violates its trademark rights.
- The lawsuit, filed on Jan. 30, alleges infringement of PSS’s trademark established in 2022.
- PSS provides software services focusing on AI and data analytics and was founded in 2017.
- PSS declined an offer from Perplexity AI to purchase the trademark in 2023.
- After sending a cease-and-desist letter in October 2024, PSS proceeded with legal action.
- Perplexity AI, established in 2022, operates an AI-powered search engine with a multi-billion-dollar valuation.
- Both companies have not commented on the case yet.

items.title: Microsoft forms new unit to study AI impact
items.summary:
- Microsoft launches the Advanced Planning Unit (APU) to study AI’s societal, health, and workplace impacts.
- The APU will be led by Muhammad Suleyman and will conduct research, draft recommendations, and publish reports.
- The unit aims to recruit experts from various fields including economics and advanced sciences, with offices in Silicon Valley and London.
- This initiative is part of Microsoft's broader commitment to AI innovation, as stated by CEO Satya Nadella.
- The creation of the APU reflects industry trends, such as OpenAI's recent appointment of a chief economist to address AI impacts.

items.title: Microsoft forms new unit to study AI impact
items.summary:
- Microsoft has launched the **Advanced Planning Unit (APU)** to study AI's impact on society, health, and the workplace.
- The APU is led by **Muhammad Suleyman**, CEO of Microsoft AI, and will conduct research and publish reports on AI's effects.
- Recruitment will include experts from fields like economics and psychology, with offices in **Silicon Valley** and **London**.
- This initiative aligns with Microsoft CEO **Satya Nadella's** commitment to AI innovation and reflects broader industry trends in addressing AI's societal challenges.

items.title: Global chipmaker STMicroelectronics to cut up to 3,000 jobs
items.summary:
- STMicroelectronics plans to cut 2,000 to 3,000 jobs, representing up to 6% of its workforce, due to ongoing industry challenges.
- Job reductions will mainly impact regions in Italy and France through attrition and voluntary early retirement programs.
- The company has faced declining demand in industrial and automotive sectors, leading to lowered financial projections for 2024, deemed one of the industry's most challenging years.
- STMicroelectronics' share price has dropped over 45% in the last year, and its Q1 revenue forecast fell short of expectations.

items.title: Japanese firm sees DeepSeek boosting long-term chip demand
items.summary:
- JSR Corp. expects DeepSeek's AI model to boost long-term semiconductor demand.
- Executive Kenichi Emoto states AI technologies will not drastically change operations.
- JSR supplies photoresists for major clients like TSMC, Intel, Samsung, and ASML.
- JSR was delisted in 2024 after a takeover by Japan Investment Corp.
- The company aims to consolidate Japan's semiconductor materials sector and emphasizes collaboration among industry players.

items.title: US eyes DeepSeek talent to compete in AI, Senate hears
items.summary:
- Washington lawmakers are looking to engage top AI talent from China to remain competitive in AI.
- Melanie Hart from the Atlantic Council advocated for attracting engineers from the Chinese start-up DeepSeek.
- The committee highlighted the need to protect intellectual property and national security while acquiring talent.

items.title: Tencent-backed lender enters Hong Kong Web3 industry
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Tencent-backed WeBank has launched a subsidiary, WeBank Technology Services, to enter Hong Kong’s Web3 industry, operational since January.
- The subsidiary aims to enhance Web3 infrastructure while adhering to local regulatory standards.
- WeBank’s CIO, Henry Ma, emphasizes the need for a robust and regulator-friendly Web3 environment as Hong Kong seeks to become a virtual asset hub.
- Founded in 2014 with Tencent, WeBank is China's largest online-only lender, valued at 235 billion yuan (US$32.4 billion) last year.
- WeBank also runs the open-source blockchain platform FISCO BCOS, servicing over 500 application sectors in China.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.author: Yeo Cheng Yong, Terence Lee
items.summary:
- The article provides insights into the funding landscape in Southeast Asia.
- It is divided into two sections: *weekly update* and *macro trends*.
- The *weekly update* highlights notable investors and companies in the region.
- The *macro trends* section analyzes funding distribution across countries, verticals, and stages.
- The article emphasizes the need for premium content subscription to access detailed charts and visual data.

items.title: Dubai Financial Market reported $111.4m profit in 2024
items.summary:
- The Dubai Financial Market (DFM) achieved a net profit (pre-tax) of AED 409.3 million (US$111.43 million) in 2024, up 24%.
- The DFM General Index increased by 27.1%, closing at 5,158.67 points, the highest since 2014.
- Market capitalization rose by 32% to AED 907 billion (US$246 billion) by December 2024.
- Revenue increased by 15.5% to AED 632.3 million (US$172.15 million), while expenses slightly rose to AED 223 million (US$60.71 million).
- A cash dividend of AED 256 million (US$69.7 million) was proposed, amounting to 97% of retained earnings.
- The DFM welcomed 138,262 new investors, marking a 120.5% increase, with 85% being foreign nationals.
- Public offerings from companies like Parkin and Spinneys raised AED 10.48 billion (US$2.85 billion), a significant increase compared to AED 1.97 billion in 2023.

items.title: Singapore ensures compliance amid DeepSeek-Nvidia probe
items.summary:
- Singapore's authorities are conducting a probe into DeepSeek and Nvidia.
- The focus of the investigation is on regulatory compliance in the tech industry.
- This scrutiny follows various compliance issues and aims to enhance oversight.
